revised_title: Extinct Australian Marsupial Carnivore: Thylacoleo Carnifex Skull Analysis
tldr: This article describes the analysis of an almost complete skull of the extinct marsupial carnivore Thylacoleo Carnifex, focusing on its cranial and dental features. The author deduces that Thylacoleo belongs to the Diprotodont group, which is characteristic of the Australian continent. The study provides insights into the evolution and classification of marsupial carnivores, highlighting the unique features of this species and its relation to other extinct and existing marsupials.
